content:
Diagnosis:		Prostate adenocarcinoma (ductal variant), T3bN1M0

Management:		Commenced androgen deprivation therapy January 2024
		Started radiotherapy 15 March 2024

Histology:		Gleason 4+4 (Grade Group 4) ductal adenocarcinoma
		PSA at diagnosis 28.4

Current situation:	Week 4 of radiotherapy

[redacted name] is attending for review during radical radiotherapy to prostate and pelvic nodes. He is managing treatment well with good compliance. PSA has dropped to 0.8 from 28.4 at diagnosis. He reports mild urinary frequency but maintains good bladder control. Bowel habit remains regular with no significant change. Performance status remains 0.

Latest blood tests show testosterone at castrate level (<0.4) and normal renal function. He will complete planned radiotherapy next week. We will arrange PSA check in 6 weeks and review in combined clinic with urology team.

cancer_timeline.value: Started radical radiotherapy to prostate and pelvic nodes
PSA dropped to 0.8, testosterone at castrate level <0.4

patient_facts.value: Mild urinary frequency with maintained bladder control

status_updates.value: Locally advanced prostate cancer responding well to hormone therapy and currently receiving radical radiotherapy
Good biochemical response with PSA reduction from 28.4 to 0.8
Continuing radiotherapy with good compliance, due to complete next week
Review in combined clinic with urology team
